intro: Kyllinga bracheilema, commonly known as the broadleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features erect, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often reddish in color. Kyllinga bracheilema typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
